title: audio_player: improve slider tick visibility
description:
Goal:
Make AudioPlayer SliderWithTicks scene timestamp markers clearly visible.
Definition of Done:
- Tick marker height/width increased for better visibility
- Tick marker color adjusted for higher contrast
- build/clippy/tests run for choreo_components
Notes:
Focus on audio player slider usage and shared slider_with_ticks rendering.
notes:
Audit Findings (2026-02-08):
1) High - Play/pause flicker possible due to optimistic UI state writes before actor confirmation (main_page_binding.rs:1482, audio_player_view_model.rs:121, main_page_binding.rs:661).
2) High - Slider ownership can get stuck in user-interaction mode if drag-complete is missed; actor sync remains blocked (main_page_binding.rs:661, audio_player_view_model.rs:259, slider_with_ticks.slint:36/130/142).
3) High - Latest-event-wins violated by command drop on try_borrow_mut failure in open/close/link behaviors (open_audio_file_behavior.rs:66, close_audio_file_behavior.rs:40, audio_player_link_scene_behavior.rs:57).
4) Medium - Duplicate ownership for tick/link state between main_page_binding timer and AudioPlayerTicksBehavior (main_page_binding.rs:672, audio_player_ticks_behavior.rs:51).
5) Medium - Link-scene bus path is bypassed by direct UI mutation in binding (main_page_binding.rs:1461) while view-model/behavior path also exists.
6) Medium - Position publish behavior uses borrow() (panic risk) instead of non-failing access (audio_player_position_changed_behavior.rs:45).

Plan Alignment Confirmed:
- SeekAndPlay(abs_pos) is atomic in actor.
- Coalescing preserves arrival order via sequence index.
- Slider emits position_changed only from user-driven set_value.

- While multi-touch is active, pointer drag does not mutate viewport transform.
- Specs cover regression where first/single touch takes over during two-finger interaction.

title: preferences: add platform persistence implementations

Mirror .NET MAUI Preferences behavior for settings persistence across platforms in the Rust port, aligned with MAUI platform storage conventions (iOS NSUserDefaults, Android SharedPreferences, Windows ApplicationDataContainer).
Definition of Done:
- Research MAUI Preferences/IPreferences platform backends and shared-name behavior.
- Propose Rust interfaces and platform-specific implementations that match MAUI semantics.
- Add integration plan for use in choreo_components preferences module.
Notes:
- Prefer existing Rust crates where possible over custom implementations.
- Consider using confy + serde for settings persistence if it fits platform targets.
- MAUI docs: Preferences/IPreferences use native stores (NSUserDefaults/SharedPreferences/ApplicationDataContainer) for app/user preferences.

Stack trace shows overflow during choreo_components::ui::slint_generatedSplashScreen::InnerShellHost::item_array() before ShellHost::new() returns. Likely Slint component graph or large item array; consider bisection or larger stack test.
notes: Root cause: RefCell borrow during floor behavior activation (draw_floor_behavior bind in activate) caused panic and STATUS_STACK_BUFFER_OVERRUN. Fixed by splitting behavior activation into initialize/bind and binding after releasing the RefCell borrow; floor behaviors now bind via Rc<RefCell>.
